author: Special Correspondent
text:
About Rs. 3.5 crore cash belonging to three banks which was taken by a van was seized by a team led by Srirangam Tahsildar in Tiruchi on Friday.— PHOTO: A. MURALITHARAN

A Static Surveillance Team (SST) seized Rs. 3.28 crore in cash that was being transported in a van of a private agency without proper documents for filling automated teller machines of three banks here on Friday.

The SST intercepted the van on the Kumbakonathan Salai in Srirangam in the afternoon.

The officials found cash kept in three boxes.

The cash belonged to Canara Bank, the State Bank of India, and the Karur Vysya Bank.

Official sources said the team seized the huge amount of cash as it was being transported without any documents.

The vehicle along with the cash was brought to the Srirangam Taluk Office. Information was conveyed to the three banks regarding the seizure.

Bankers meet officials

The sources said officials from the three banks came to the Srirangam Taluk Office and were told to approach the Personal Assistant (Accounts) to the Collector and furnish supporting documents to take possession of the cash.

Meanwhile, the cash was deposited in the Srirangam Sub Treasury.
title: Surveillance team seizes Rs. 3.28 cr. cash
